ayas.translation: I swear by the daybreak,
And the ten nights,
And the even and the odd,
And the night when it departs.

ayas.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
ayas.translation: Truly in that there is an oath for those who possess understanding.
ayas.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamul lidhī ḥijr

ayas.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
ayas.translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with Ad,
ayas.transliteration: alam tara kayfa fa`ala rabbuka bi`ād

ayas.translation: (The people of) Aram, possessors of lofty buildings,

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
ayas.translation: The like of which were not created in the (other) cities;
ayas.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fil bilād

ayas.translation: And (with) Samood, who hewed out the rocks in the valley,
ayas.transliteration: wathamūdal ladhīna jābuṣ ṣakhra bil wād

ayas.translation: And (with) Firon, the lord of hosts,
Who committed inordinacy in the cities,
So they made great mischief therein?
Therefore your Lord let down upon them a portion of the chastisement.
Most surely your Lord is watching.

ayas.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
ayas.translation: And as for man, when his Lord tries him, then treats him with honor and makes him lead an easy life, he says: My Lord honors me.
ayas.transliteration: fa-ammal-insānu idhā mab-talāhu rabbuhu fa-akramahu wana``amahu fayaqūlu rabbī akraman

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
ayas.translation: But when He tries him (differently), then straitens to him his means of subsistence, he says: My Lord has disgraced me.
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā idhā mab-talāhu faqadara `alayhi rizqahu fayaqūlu rabbī ahānan

ayas.translation: Nay! but you do not honor the orphan,
Nor do you urge one another to feed the poor,
And you eat away the heritage, devouring (everything) indiscriminately,
And you love wealth with exceeding love.

ayas.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
ayas.translation: Nay! when the earth is made to crumble to pieces,
And your Lord comes and (also) the angels in ranks,
ayas.transliteration: wajā-a rabbuka wal malaku ṣaffan ṣaffā

ayas.arabic: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
ayas.translation: And hell is made to appear on that day. On that day shall man be mindful, and what shall being mindful (then) avail him?
ayas.transliteration: wajī-a yawma-idhin bijahannam ۚ yawma-idhiy yatadhakkarul-insānu wa-annā lahudh dhikrā

ayas.translation: He shall say: O! would that I had sent before for (this) my life!
But on that day shall no one chastise with (anything like) His chastisement,
And no one shall bind with (anything like) His binding.
O soul that art at rest!
Return to your Lord, well-pleased (with him), well-pleasing (Him),
So enter among My servants,
And enter into My garden.
